arm_group.description: The patients follow only a 1200 Kcal diet
The patients undergo PENS of dermatome T7 and follow a 1200 Kcal diet

brief_summary.textblock:
Percutaneous neurostimulation of dermatome T7 increases Insulin segregation by the apancreas
      and improves glycemic profile in diabetic patients

clinical_study.brief_title: Percutaneous Electric Neurostimulation of Dermatome T7 Improves Glycemic Profile in Obese and Typo 2 Diabetic Patients
condition: Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus With Features of Insulin Resistance

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  BMI>30 Kg/m2

          -  Type 2 diabetes mellitus

          -  Treatment with Metformin

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Under insulin treatment

          -  Endocrinological disorders causing diabetes mellitus

intervention.description: The patients undergo PENS of dermatome T7 and follow a 1200 Kcal diet

clinical_study.keyword: Percutaneous neurostimulation; dermatome T7, type 2 diabetes

oversight_info.authority: Spain: Comité Ético de Investigación Clínica

primary_outcome.description: Serum glucose levels will be recorded will be recorded at baseline and 12 weeks after beginning the treatment. Measurement units will be mg/dl.
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and 12 weeks after beginning the therapy

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: Insulin resistance will be recorded by the Homeostasis model assessment (HOMA). The calculation formula is: Serum Glucose x Serum Insulin / 405
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and 12 weeks after beginning the therapy

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Single Blind (Investigator), Primary Purpose: Treatment
